intro: Pepinia maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's pepinia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes various parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in wet, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
